revised_title: The Role and Function of the Royal Society in Publishing Philosophical Transactions
tldr: The Royal Society's Committee clarifies the process of selecting and publishing papers in the Philosophical Transactions. They explain that the Society does not give opinions on subjects and that the thanks given to authors are a matter of civility. They also discourage crediting reports and public notices as an indicator of the Society's approval.
